result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura Marie Leary was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft/Possess Stolen Card, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack July 16, 2014 - Vacate prior sentence and amend Count 1 to 943.41(3)(e)2.

Court notes 40 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $388.09 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF206.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case 14CF206.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF206.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent within 30 days.

-Any Assessment requested by Agent within 30 days.
-Cooperate with any correctional program as directed by Agent.
-No Contact with Joseph Place or any Drug Dealer.
-No Contact with any Casino.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Obtain employment.
-Apology letter to Victims.
-Victim Empathy Seminar.
-Restorative Justice if requested.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Must participate and successfully complete Drug Court Program.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: Condition time STAYED, to be released on July 23, 2014 after Drug Court.

supervisions.notes:
With good time.
Huber approved for work and treatment.
Costs to be converted into civil judgment.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Laura Marie Leary appeared from jail. Case called at 2:32 pm. Court reviews file. Defendant entered Guilty Plea to wrong statute number. Court vacates prior sentence and amends Count 1 to 943.41(3)(e)2.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to amended Count 1. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty amended Count 1. Court adopts previous sentence. Defendant has 40 days credit as of today. km

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Laura Marie Leary appeared from jail. Case called at 9:09 am. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Caton. ADA Nieskes moves to amend Count 1 to 943.41(3)(b). Court amends. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for Amended Count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def Guilty of Amended Count 1. Victim's make statements.
